thread.title: Harry Kane or Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Stats show which striker's absence will be a bigger problem for their team
thread.title_full: Harry Kane or Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Stats show which striker's absence will be a bigger problem for their team

author: Richard Innes
title: Harry Kane or Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Stats show which striker's absence will be a bigger problem for their team
text:
Who's the most vital attacking lynchpin? (Photo: Man Utd/Getty Images) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Losing Harry Kane has left Tottenham fans distraught. Being without Zlatan Ibrahimovic has got Manchester United fans terrified. 
But whose absence will be the most keenly felt? 
The fact Spurs and United supporters are worried about their team's prospects without their main men is understandable. After all, Kane (potentially out for the rest of the season with an ankle injury) and Zlatan (suspended for three games) are the two most vital goalscorers in the Premier League. Kane crunched (Photo: Getty Images) Zlatan doing the crunching (Photo: REUTERS) 
That may seem like a bold claimâ€¦ but only until you see this chart. 
Looking purely at the Premier League's top six, it shows the percentage of each team's total goals that have been scored by their main striker: Percentage of team's total goals Premier League, top six clubs only 
As you can see, Zlatan and Kane score more of their team's Premier League goals than any other player at the top clubs. 
So, with both of them missing, who is going to have the bigger headache filling the void: Jose Mourinho or Mauricio Pochettino. 
The answer, quite categorically, is Mourinho. (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
The graph above shows Zlatan has scored a massive 38.4 percent of United's Premier League goals this season. Kane has scored 35.8 percent of Tottenham's. 
When you look at their share of goals in all competitions, Zlatan is still ahead: Percentage of team's goals scored Zlatan
